ygData.subject: Re: Pulsating brood clutch (off-topic)
ygData.msgSnippet: you mean you saw the crookstinger on your list and you didnt go slay it?!?! argh I have been searching high and low for that beasts and the possibility of its
ygData.messageBody:
you mean you saw the crookstinger on your list and you didnt go slay it?!?! argh
I have been searching high and low for that beasts and the possibility of its
poisonous blade. *sighs and wanders back into lesser fay on Veeshan*
Penaden Songweaver
Vizier of Akalabeth
www.lostorder.com

"Reece, Tom CPT - 30th Signal Bn" wrote:

> From: "Reece, Tom CPT - 30th Signal Bn" <ReeceT@...>
>
> Sorry about posting off-topic but for some reason I have email access but
> not Internet access. As a result, I can't post this question on EQVault.
>
> Last night while adventuring in Lesser Faydark, my party was attacked by the
> Spider Queen (can't remember her last name). I had never seen this NPC
> before so perhaps this is part of a new quest. I do know we killed a lot of
> giant spiders so that may have caused her to spawn. Anyway, after we killed
> her, I looted an item called a pulsating brood clutch. Right-clicking on
> the item only displayed the name and the weight. Didn't mention anything
> like Lore/Magic item. I asked around and no one had ever heard of this
> item. I went to a shop and was offered 7PP for it. Thinking it may be a
> quest item, I decided not to sell it. I also looted a poison sac from the
> Queen. The icons for the two items are similar, both looking like a kidney.
> My guess is if this item is not a quest item, it can be used by a rogue to
> create poison, although I don't think this skill has been implemented yet.
>
> Does anyone have any information on this item? I need the PP but if its
> part of a quest would like to try and solve it.
>
> On a related note, I saw three other named NPCs in Lesser Faydark last
> night. One was Crookstinger, a NPC wasp, another was a named fairie whose
> name I can't recollect, and the unicorn Equestrielle. In addition to the
> Spider Queen, I had never seen any of these NPCs before. There were several
> groups in the area attacking both wasps and fairie creatures. The general
> consensus of everyone in the area was that killing these creatures caused
> Crookstinger and the named fairie to appear. No one was foolish/brave
> enough to attack the unicorn. Its good to see that Verant has started to
> beef up some of the zones. Has anyone notived similar additions in other
> zones?
>
> Galtin
> E'ci
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> It's finally here! What's your opinion?
> http://www.onelist.com
> Create a Star Wars discussion group at ONElist.
